posts.message:
Lately, there are a few posts asking about pieces of hardware. I found them "not exactly following the group rules" but as and admin I didn't really decide to delete them, specially that they were commented on by a few group members.
But, today is the second time I find one of these flagged by group remembers, i.e. it's not only me that find those posts on the fringes of being spam.
So, what should we do?

Hey fellow OSs geeks :D
So unfortunately, my PC isn't good enough for Yosemite.. I suffered from constant lag and crashing.
So I got back to the boring Windows 8.1 and I got bored again so I searched for something else and I found this amazing Linux distro called Deeping..
I had some experience with Ubuntu in the past, but I hated the Unity DE.
Now this distro is based on Ubuntu..so anything you can do/install on Ubuntu you can here.
It looks amazing and it has some great features including it's own DE and Launcher. and it's packed with a decent music and video players and a great software store.
You can download it from the official site here: http://www.linuxdeepin.com/index.en.html
Nice read, especially the part of schemaless storage, leads to implicit schema hidden in your application.

posts.message:
Turning EMACS into a Python IDE, you will never know the pleasure of coding until you do it on EMACS with auto complete :)

P.S. it took me ages to find this, I spent a week trying to do it 2 months ago but I gave up, then this made it very easy and I got to enjoy it finally, I couldn't sleep out of pure happiness. I am still looking for a way to set up a short cut to run the code in the buffer, would appreciate some Geeky input here

posts.description: How to make Emacs into a Python editor/IDE with elpy.el mode,which makes coding Python in Emacs easier w/Jedi and Rope.Details:http://onthecode.com/post/7881...

posts.message: Guys, I'm thinking about doing a basic session explaining source control and team workflow using Git. Is someone interested in such a session? Can someone help in coordination/planning?

I need a Real-time collaborative tool where I can teach someone some HTML and CSS and the code would be debugged in front of us both. 
(And yes, I tried google, but I don't need it for JS and RUBY, I only need it for HTML and CSS) 
Example: codebits on http://www.codeacademy.com  (but this one isn't Real-time)
